text: I am Josh McMann and chef David jeans at
Portland Oregon the vegetable focus of
the menu was the most natural thing that
happened because of my background of
working on a farm they're all within a
season and it's perfect as all that
stuff tastes great
together right now David James we
probably have about 20 to 25 different
vegetables on the menu carrot and beet
slaw is based largely on the idea of I
love raw vegetables we manipulate it a
little bit with vinegar and we're just
adding to that again like olive oil and
that's different textures different
flavors the mixed greens is just one of
those things that when I was in Italy or
even at you know great Italian
restaurant says always a cooked
vegetable component and in Italy it was
generally always cooked a little bit
more than I would like I love the idea
that there's texture and vegetables
especially greens the celery dish for me
honestly is based on the idea that I
think celery's delicious so it becomes a
celery salad it's all about celery all
we do is just simply dress it and treat
it right with lemon juice dates chilies
the right amount of salt the right
amount of pepper the cheese and it's so
unbelievably simple
fire has always been one of the things I
just love to have around it was one of
those things that was built out of the
idea of this is exactly what I want to
eat right now I'm hungry
it always starts with olive oil in the
pan blooming me the garlic blooming the
chilies and then just where you go from
there whatever season you're in its
maybe a million different things today
the one that you're gonna have is it has
a mixture of mushrooms pickle carrots
some raw kale that we cooked down
chilies garlic and an egg it's a
challenge to be able to get the level
and the amount of food that we have on
the menu and have it all been delicious
and fresh it absolutely makes sense to
me the vegetables being as beautiful as
there should be on the plate in the same
way you know they're just telling their
story and we're just helping that
process
